p: Data on the antioxidant activities of the methanol extract of ultrasonicated basil leaves ( Ocimum basilicum) under the optimized conditions, as well as their isolated compound (KA), are presented in Table 9. The antioxidant activity of the methanol extract of ultrasonicated Ocimum basilicum was IC 50 = 50.10 μg/mL. In contrast, the antioxidant activity of KA (IC 50 = 0.68 μg/mL) was higher with respect to the reference ascorbic acid (IC 50 = 0.79 μg/mL) and BHT (IC 50 = 0.88 μg/mL). The present study was in accordance with the work of Shafique et al. [ 39], who reported that O. basilicum extracts exhibited and offered higher antioxidant activity compared to synthetic antioxidant BHT.
